business.headline: RBI announces big push for business reforms and easier lending. Details hereThe Reserve Bank of India has unveiled a set of measures aimed at making it easier for businesses to operate and improving access to loans. The reforms are expected to help companies, exporters, and banks alike.

RBI holds repo rate at 5.5%: How it impacts your EMIsBy keeping the repo rate unchanged at 5.5%, the RBI has signalled stability for borrowers. Home loan EMIs are likely to stay where they are, offering some relief to existing and new buyers.

RBI holds lending rate steady at 5.5%, maintains neutral stanceThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept the key repo rate unchanged at 5.5% as the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), led by Governor Sanjay Malhotra, concluded its three-day meeting. The central bank also maintained its neutral stance.

LG Electronics India IPO opens next week: 5 key details investors must knowLG Electronics is set to launch the third-largest IPO of 2025, after Tata Capital's Rs 15,500 crore issue scheduled between October 6 and October 8, and HDB Financial Services, which raised Rs 12,500 crore in June this year.
Sensex opens nearly 100 points higher, Nifty above 24,500; Sun Pharma up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 58.51 points to 80,326.13, while the NSE NIfty50 added 25.65 points to 24,636.75 as of 9:24 am.

RBI MPC decision today: Will there be a surprise rate cut?India has seen supportive fiscal measures this year, including changes in income tax slabs and GST cuts, which are expected to boost consumption during the festive season.

Government keeps PPF, NSC and other small savings rates unchanged. Check hereThe government has kept interest rates unchanged for key small savings schemes, including PPF and NSC, for the upcoming quarter.

LG Electronics India's Rs 15,000 crore IPO to open on October 7. Check detailsThe much-anticipated IPO of LG Electronics India, worth Rs 15,000 crore, is scheduled to open on October 7. Here's everything you need to know.

Behind the buffet: How restaurants profit from all-you-can-eat deals'All you can eat.' That is how buffets work. But then how do famous buffets such as BBQ Nation, The GT Road, and Pirates of Grill, with prices ranging from Rs 900-1400, make a profit serving unlimited food?

Gold and silver lead the way as investors seek stability, says expertWith stock market volatility unsettling investors, many are turning to gold and silver for safety. Experts say the renewed interest in precious metals reflects a broader search for stability amid uncertain conditions.
Sensex, Nifty fall for 8th day in a row ahead of RBI MPC decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 97.32 points to close at 80,267.62, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 23.80 points to end at 24,611.10.

Why staying consistent matters more than timing the market, says expertWhile market swings grab attention, experts insist that consistent investing, rather than trying to predict peaks and dips, is what helps investors achieve reliable growth over time.

entertainment.headline: BB19 episode 38: Nominations trigger major showdown between Nehal and Tanya In the latest 'Bigg Boss' episode, nominations sparked heated arguments and strategic plays, with Farrhana prioritising Nehal over Neelam and multiple contestants facing the nomination list. Personal stories and confrontations, including a major fight between Nehal and Tanya, added to the drama inside the house.

Tere Ishk Mein teaser: Dhanush as jilted lover set to destroy Kriti Sanon's world The teaser of Tere Ishk Mein was unveiled today starring Dhanush and Kriti Sanon. The film promises a soulful love story with music by AR Rahman and releases worldwide in November 2025.
Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja expecting their second child: Sources Actor Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja are expecting their second child, as per sources. Official announcement to follow soon.

Tom Cruise and Ana de Armas planning a space wedding? Tom Cruise and Ana de Armas are reportedly planning an extraordinary wedding, possibly in outer space, reflecting their shared love for adventure and thrill.

Who is Vishal Brahma, SOTY 2 actor allegedly arrested with Rs 40 crore drugs? Struggling Bollywood actor Vishal Brahma was arrested at Chennai airport for allegedly trafficking methaqualone worth Rs 40 crore, reportedly linked to a Nigerian drug syndicate. Brahma, known for his role in 'Student of the Year 2', is believed to have been driven to the crime due to financial distress.

The chilling Guliga scream that made Kantara roar outside Karnataka When Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara' released in 2022, it seamlessly blended social commentary and tribal folklore. But what made it a masterpiece was the goosebumps-inducing scream of the Guliga Daiva.

They Call Him OG box office Day 6: Pawan Kalyan's film earns Rs 154 crore in a week 'They Call Him OG', starring Pawan Kalyan, continues to perform strongly at the box office, earning Rs 154 crore in its first week despite mixed reviews.

Mammootty arrives in Hyderabad for Patriot shoot, meets Anurag Kashyap Actor Mammootty arrived in Hyderabad for the new filming schedule of 'Patriot' amid health speculation. He was welcomed by filmmaker Anurag Kashyap at the hotel.

Madonna says embracing spirituality helped her deal with sepsis Madonna revealed details of her 2023 hospitalisation due to sepsis and how Kabbalah helped her recovery. Her experience highlights the role of spirituality and acceptance in overcoming serious illness.

Deepika Padukone claims top spot in new IMDb list, talks of challenging status quo Deepika Padukone ranked top among female actors in IMDb's 25-year Indian cinema report. She emphasised challenging norms and hopes to inspire future actors.

AI 'actress' Tilly Norwood denounced by Hollywood's SAG-AFTRA SAG-AFTRA, or the Screen Actors Guild and the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists, has denounced Tilly Norwood, the AI-generated 'actress' created by Eline Van der Velden

Shah Rukh Khan named India's most prolific star by IMDb IMDb report highlights Shah Rukh Khan's prominence in Indian cinema over 25 years. Shift in stardom dynamics with more actors sharing the spotlight in recent years.

AR Rahman on music legacy, AI, virtual groups, KPop Demon Hunters AR Rahman is pioneering a virtual musical universe called Secret Mountain with global collaborators. This project aims to unite cultures through AI-driven music while preserving human creativity.

Tom Holland clarifies relationship status with Zendaya Actor Tom Holland corrected a journalist who called Zendaya his girlfriend during a panel. Their engagement has been carefully planned, but wedding preparations are yet to begin.

John Mayer to make Mumbai debut next year, calls India a long-time dream Singer John Mayer to perform live in Mumbai for the first time in January next year. The event at Mahalaxmi Racecourse is produced and promoted by BookMyShow Live.

Confidence Queen review: A stylish heist drama that balances wit and suspenseRelease Date:Sat Sep 06, 2025 Confidence Queen is a stylish K-drama that blends heist thrills with deep emotional storytelling. The show's clever scams and strong characters keep viewers hooked despite minor plot distractions.

Lahore 1947: Sunny Deol resumes shoot after Aamir Khan suggests changes Actor Sunny Deol returned to shoot the final schedule of 'Lahore 1947' in Punjab following Aamir Khan's creative input. The film's release has been postponed to 2026 to ensure superior quality and vision.

Tere Ishk Mein: What to expect from Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's film Filmmaker Aanand L Rai and Dhanush reunite for the romantic drama 'Tere Ishk Mein'. The teaser hints at a passionate love story with soulful music and new character dynamics.

Actor Mandana Karimi hospitalised: My last heartbeat turned out to be exhaustion Actor Mandana Karimi was hospitalised after fearing she had felt her last heartbeat. Extensive tests later confirmed her condition was caused by extreme exhaustion, dehydration, and stress rather than a heart problem.

general news.headline: US government shuts down in 6-year first, may lead to mass layoffsThe 15th government shutdown since 1981 is set to halt the release of the closely watched September employment report, slow air travel, suspend scientific research, withhold pay for American troops, and furlough 750,000 federal workers -- costing the government $400 million each day.

Collect Asia Cup trophy in person, PCB chief directs Suryakumar Yadav: ReportPakistan Cricket Board chief and Asian Cricket Council head Mohsin Naqvi has refused to give the Asia Cup trophy to India. Pakistani news channel Geo Super reported that he has directed Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav to collect it in person from the ACC office.

Trump reposts Modi's support for Gaza peace plan without adding his own wordsDonald Trump reshared PM Modi's endorsement of his Gaza peace plan, which Modi called a "viable pathway" to lasting peace and security, urging all parties to unite behind Trump's initiative.

No congestion tax in Bengaluru. DK Shivakumar says infra projects will ease trafficKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar ruled out any congestion tax in Bengaluru. In a conversation with India Today, he said traffic solutions lie in infrastructure projects like ring roads and flyovers.

Near Chicken's Neck, India launches two rail lines to connect BhutanIndia has announced its first-ever railway links to Bhutan, which will enhance trade, tourism, and strategic connectivity. The Kokrajhar-Gelephu and Banarhat-Samtse lines near the strategic Chicken's Neck will integrate Bhutan with India's rail network while strengthening Northeast India's security and supply chains.

Delhi molester baba's chats reveal sex demands, 'Dubai Sheikh' trafficking angleSwami Chaitanyananda Saraswati, the former head of a management institute in Vasant Kunj, was arrested in Agra last week after more than 15 women students accused him of molestation, blackmail and intimidation.

Wah Trump ji wah! Opportunity that India shouldn't missAs US President Donald Trump pitches a Gaza peace plan in his bid for a Nobel Peace Prize, world leaders have rushed to applaud. India has lauded Trump's peace bid with PM Narendra Modi's message translated into seven world languages. This comes amid a low point in Indo-US ties. Trump has presented an opportunity and India must resort to realpolitik.

Voter list discrepancies in Maharashtra, Congress alleges 'vote theft'Allegations of large-scale voter list manipulation have surfaced in Maharashtra's Rajura assembly seat. Congress leaders claim fake voter enrolment and 'vote theft', raising concerns over electoral transparency in the region.

UP couple caught on CCTV stealing gold necklace worth Rs 6 lakh from jewellery shopA couple stole a gold necklace from a jewellery showroom in Bulandshahr. Police are investigating with CCTV footage to identify the accused soon.
Learn How Adobe Express Is Making Graphic Design Fun In ClassroomsThe Adobe Express app is available on any smart device or desktop computer.

What would you have done if you were PM during Pahalgam attack? Owaisi repliesAsaduddin Owaisi refuses to entertain a question about his actions as a hypothetical Prime Minister during the Pahalgam terror attack, saying he concentrates on reality and his current political responsibilities instead of speculation.

RSS at 100: A century of sewa, sangathan and sacrificeThe RSS centenary is a testament to sacrifice, devotion, and resilience. Despite hardships and bans, swayamsevaks, families, and saints kept the mission alive. Rooted in public support, the Sangh's work now seeks deeper societal participation for nation-building.

The chilling Guliga scream that made Kantara roar outside KarnatakaWhen Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara' released in 2022, it seamlessly blended social commentary and tribal folklore. But what made it a masterpiece was the goosebumps-inducing scream of the Guliga Daiva.

75-year-old man marries 35-year-old woman in UP, dies next morningA 75-year-old man from Jaunpur died unexpectedly the day after marrying a 35-year-old woman. His family has raised suspicion over the cause of death and halted funeral proceedings pending further investigation.

Zubeen Garg's manager, fest organiser arrested; sent to 14-day police custodyNEIF organiser Shyamkanu Mahanta was detained in Singapore and first brought to Delhi before being flown to Guwahati. Zubeen Garg's aide Siddharth Sharma was detained in Gurugram.

Philippines earthquake: Tectonic forces behind the 6.9 quake explainedThe death toll has climbed to at least 69, with more than 150 others injured as homes, churches, and public infrastructure suffered severe damage.
Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja expecting their second child: SourcesActor Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja are expecting their second child, as per sources. Official announcement to follow soon.

PCOS vs PCOD: It's not a disease, it's a syndrome says expertsPCOS and PCOD are often used interchangeably, but they are not the same. Experts explain how they differ, their symptoms, and which condition may require more medical attention.

Tom Cruise and Ana de Armas planning a space wedding?Tom Cruise and Ana de Armas are reportedly planning an extraordinary wedding, possibly in outer space, reflecting their shared love for adventure and thrill.

RBI holds lending rate steady at 5.5%, maintains neutral stanceThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept the key repo rate unchanged at 5.5% as the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), led by Governor Sanjay Malhotra, concluded its three-day meeting. The central bank also maintained its neutral stance.

Cycle-Breaking Parenting: Why younger generation is rewriting the rulebookIf you want to shield your little one from the negative experiences you faced as a child, you are moving toward a cycle-breaking parenting style. This approach not only helps your kid become emotionally stronger but also allows you to heal.

You saved millions: Asim Munir praised my India-Pak ceasefire, says TrumpDonald Trump said that Pakistan Army chief Asim Munir told him he saved millions of lives during the India-Pakistan conflict, calling the acknowledgement "beautiful".

How Navratri fasts affect blood sugar in diabeticsDuring fasting, long gaps between meals can disrupt the delicate balance of blood sugar. Dr Vimal Pahuja, MD, Associate Director, Internal Medicine & Metabolic Physician, Diabetes & Weight Management Clinic, Dr L.H. Hiranandani Hospital, Powai, Mumbai, explains how to fast safely.

Delhi High Court shields Nagarjuna's personality rights, blocks misused contentDelhi High Court has protected actor Nagarjuna Akkineni's personality and moral rights. Ten websites using his name and images without consent must block content. Government departments are directed to enforce the removal of URLs.

Tere Ishk Mein teaser: Dhanush as jilted lover set to destroy Kriti Sanon's worldThe teaser of Tere Ishk Mein was unveiled today starring Dhanush and Kriti Sanon. The film promises a soulful love story with music by AR Rahman and releases worldwide in November 2025.
Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja expecting their second child: SourcesActor Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja are expecting their second child, as per sources. Official announcement to follow soon.

sports.headline: Will India shake hands with Pakistan in Colombo game? All-rounder ducks question Women's World Cup 2025: After the drama-filled Asia Cup, where politics and cricket became inseparable in the India-Pakistan clashes, the women's teams are set to meet in Colombo on Sunday. Following India's win over Sri Lanka in Guwahati, all-rounder Amanjot Kaur was asked whether Harmanpreet Kaur and her side would shake hands with their Pakistani counterparts.

Shakib Al Hasan will not play for Bangladesh again: Sports advisor The door to Shakib Al Hasan's Bangladesh return might have been shut permanently. Shakib, who has not played for Bangladesh in the past year, has fallen out with the country's sports advisor.

Neeraj watches Sumit Antil win javelin medal, shares inspirational message India's top javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra was in attendance as Sumit Antil broke the meet record to clinch World Para Athletics gold on Tuesday, September 30. After the event, Neeraj said that he would have loved to compete on the Mondo track in Delhi.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi hits 78-ball hundred in Brisbane youth Test, emulates McCullum 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi powered India U-19 into a dominant position in the first Youth Test against Australia U-19 with a blistering century, breaking multiple records at Ian Healy Oval in Brisbane.

ACC head Mohsin Naqvi refuses to hand over Asia Cup trophy to India: Report A controversy has followed the Asia Cup 2025 tournament, as Asian Cricket Council chief Mohsin Naqvi has refused to hand over the trophy to the BCCI vice president. Naqvi, who is also a Pakistan minister, has stated that Indian skipper Surya Kumar Yadav must visit the Asian Cricket Council to collect the trophy. In an interview with India Today's Nikhil Naaz, Surya Kumar Yadav addressed the situation, stating, "14 players and 10-12 support staff. That's the real trophy." He said the team's priority was to play cricket and they remained focused on the game, adding that winning the tournament was the best answer they could give to anyone. The standoff over the trophy handover continues.

Rockstar Amanjot Kaur wows Guwahati with bat and Rajinikanth-style punchlines Women's World Cup 2025: Amanjot Kaur, the daughter of a Chandigarh carpenter, stole the show in Guwahati with a fearless all-round performance. She rescued India in the World Cup opener while delivering Rajinikanth-style punchlines in the press, signalling that the next rockstar of Indian cricket is here.

Reality check: India learn about early flaws before Pakistan clash, bigger tests India were able to overcome Sri Lanka with a few hiccups along the way, but the hosts will need to iron out major issues if they're to win home World Cup. With Pakistan and bigger tests looming, India need to focus on key areas and address issues.

After Asia Cup debacle, Pakistan Cricket Board suspends NOCs for T20 leagues After their debacle in the Asia Cup 2025, Pakistan Cricket Board has refused to provide No Objection Certificates to Pakistani players who wish to play in overseas T20 leagues. The move comes after Pakistan lost thrice to India in a space of 15 days.

Collect Asia Cup trophy in person, PCB chief directs Suryakumar Yadav: Report Pakistan Cricket Board chief and Asian Cricket Council head Mohsin Naqvi has refused to give the Asia Cup trophy to India. Pakistani news channel Geo Super reported that he has directed Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav to collect it in person from the ACC office.

The standoff over the trophy handover continues.

With Pakistan and bigger tests looming, India need to focus on key areas and address issues.

The move comes after Pakistan lost thrice to India in a space of 15 days.

Pakistani news channel Geo Super reported that he has directed Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav to collect it in person from the ACC office.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
